availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles J. Clark (Louisville, Kentucky, chancery court clerk)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Eliza Logan Clark in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 2, 1835. Father of Anna P. Clark, William L. Clark, Mathilda Clark, Jenny Clark, Charles Clark, Rosa J. Clark, Benjamin Clark, Mary Clark, Maurice Clark, and Francis Clark. Chancery court clerk in Louisville in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Retired clerk in Louisville in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
